channel.title: Android on MikeDixson.com
channel.description: Recent content in Android on MikeDixson.com

item.title: Solved: Updating partition details… Unable to open zip file. Error flashing zip
item.description:
When trying to flash my old Motorola Xoom using this excellent guide http://www.xda-developers.com/motorola-xoom-still-alive-and-kicking-receives-functional-kitkat/ I was unable to flash the system and google apps zips from TWRP and received the following error:

Updating partition details...<br /> Unable to open zip file.<br /> Error flashing zip '/sdcard/update.zip

The error wasn’t quite verbose enough. I found when I tried to have another stab at flashing the recovery partition Android was more helpful and told me that the battery level was too low.

Plugging the device in I was able to flash the device straight away and bring my Xoom back to life and make use of an old tablet again!

item.title: Making your website Android Web App friendly
item.description:
Very useful bit of info on adding a couple of lines of text to your site headers and having your webpage run app-like on Android

https://developer.chrome.com/multidevice/android/installtohomescreen

item.title: Google Hangouts Firewall Ports
item.description:
Our firewall was configured as per Google’s documentation to allow the Google Hangouts nee Talk client and the Android Google Hangouts app to connect. but to no avail.
With a little bit of troubleshooting I found that an additional port needed to be opened too. So here’s the firewall ports you need to open for Google Talk:

  • 80 TCP

  • 443 TCP

  • 19302 – 19309 TCP and UDP

  • Additional Ports for various clients

    <td>
  Clients
</td>

    <td>
  XMPP clients
</td>

    <td>
  Android phones
</td>

    <td>
  XMPP federation
</td>
    Ports
    5222, 5223, 5224
    5228 and 5229
    5269

This information was taken from  Optimize your network for Hangouts

I hope that helps some of you out there.

Mike

item.title: Android Sending an SMS to multiple recipients sends as an MMS
item.description:
Happy New Year SMS not MMS

Sending out a few new years eve sms message I found that if I added more than one recipient my SMS became an MMS
A little looking around on New Years Day and I found this setting was checked by default on my Nexus 4 with ICS

Changing Android Multiple Recipients to SMS

Unchecking Group Messaging fixes this issue.
Hope that helps some of you out there.
